intro: Freylinia oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leafed freylinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Capparaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement, where leaves grow in pairs on either side of the stem. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Freylinia oppositifolia is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
